definition: pitfall/trap/to get stuck/to sink/to cave in/to frame (false charge)/to capture (a city in battle)/to fall (to the enemy)/defect

sentences.english: Whoever flees at the sound of terror will fall into a pit;
sentences.chinese: 躲避恐惧声音的必坠入陷坑。

sentences.english: More than 2,500 sinkholes now line the shores of the Dead Sea.
sentences.chinese: 在死海沿岸已经有超过2500个陷坑。

sentences.english: This type of trading leaves you vulnerable to the flow of orders into the pit.
sentences.chinese: 这类贸易使你自愿陷入程序化的陷坑。

sentences.english: More than 2, 500 sinkholes now line the shores of the Dead Sea.
sentences.chinese: 在死海沿岸已经有超过2500个陷坑。

sentences.english: Days earlier, a giant sinkhole swallowed up the entire playground of a primary school in the county.
sentences.chinese: 几天前，一个大陷坑吞噬了该县一个小学的整个操场。

sentences.english: Terror and pit and snare await you, O people of the earth.
sentences.chinese: 地上的居民哪，恐惧，陷坑，网罗，都临近你。

sentences.english: Fear, and the pit, and the snare, are upon thee, O inhabitant of the earth.
sentences.chinese: 地上的居民哪，恐惧，陷坑，网罗，都临近你。

sentences.english: No detectable pits or gray edge by visual inspection after coating.
sentences.chinese: 在镀膜后表面无可察觉的陷坑或灰色边缘。

sentences.english: Yet they have dug a pit for me.

definition: Shenkeng township in New Taipei City 新北市[Xin1 bei3 shi4], Taiwan
cheval de frise (a type of barrier)
iron hook at the end a long pole
